places_to_visit.name: St. Peter's Basilica
places_to_visit.description: St. Peter's Basilica is one of the largest and most important churches in Christianity. It is renowned for its stunning Renaissance architecture and is the burial site of Saint Peter.

places_to_visit.name: Vatican Museums
places_to_visit.description: The Vatican Museums house an extensive collection of art and historical artifacts, including masterpieces by Michelangelo and Raphael. The museums also include the Sistine Chapel.

places_to_visit.name: Sistine Chapel
places_to_visit.description: The Sistine Chapel is famous for its Michelangelo-painted ceiling and the Last Judgment. It is also the site of the papal conclave, where a new pope is elected.

places_to_visit.name: St. Peter's Square
places_to_visit.description: St. Peter's Square is the grand plaza in front of St. Peter's Basilica. It is known for its impressive colonnades and the obelisk at its center, and it is a gathering place for pilgrims and tourists alike.

places_to_visit.name: Vatican Gardens
places_to_visit.description: The Vatican Gardens are a collection of beautifully landscaped gardens, sculptures, and fountains within the Vatican City. They offer a serene retreat and are accessible through guided tours only.
